name: Male or Female? Quiz | Miscellaneous Animal Trivia | 15 Questions

questions.text: In most songbirds, which sex does the singing?
questions.explanation:
M.

	Only the males sing. Singing performs a triple function- the male advertises his claim to a territory, makes himself known to neighboring females, and proves his virility- the males who can sing the loudest and longest are the healthiest and can sire the best young.

questions.text: What sex is the largest animal in the world?
questions.explanation:
F.

	The largest animal is, of course, the blue whale. Female blue whales are larger than males.

questions.text: In almost all South American parrots, which sex is brightly colored?
questions.explanation:
B.

	Gender differences in animals are termed sexual dimorphism. South American parrots like Amazons, macaws and conures are typical of cavity-nesting birds in showing little dimorphism- it's impossible to tell males from females just by looking at them.

questions.text: In reindeer, which sex grows antlers?
questions.explanation:
B.

	Reindeer and caribou are the only deer species in which both sexes are antlered.

questions.text: Which sex of goat has a bad smell?
questions.explanation:
M.

	Female goats are odorless. The males secrete musk from glands in their head and legs. In addition, they urinate on their face and forelegs. It's a terrible stink to humans but sexy cologne to the does!

questions.text: In South American marmosets (a type of primate), which sex takes the greatest responsibility in caring for the young?
questions.explanation:
M.

	Marmosets almost always have twins. The female turns them over to the male at birth. After that, her primary function is nursing them, while the male performs almost all other care.

questions.text: In bears, which sex cares for the offspring?
questions.explanation:
F.

	They never know their father. Male bears will kill cubs.

questions.text: Which sex of vampire bat drinks blood?
questions.explanation:
B.

	Both do. It's mosquitoes that have only female blood-suckers.

questions.text: In rhinoceroses, which sex has horns?
questions.explanation:
B.

	Although males do have larger horns than females.

questions.text: In elephants, which sex leads the herd?
questions.explanation:
F.

	Elephant herds are led by matriarchs. The old females pass their knowledge of dependable water spots, food sources, etc. down to the younger members of the herd.

questions.text: In eagles, which sex cares for the young?
questions.explanation:
B.

	Both sexes bring food to the eaglets.

	Only male crickets sing. They perform by rubbing specially-adapted rear legs against their wings or by rubbing their wings together.

questions.text: What sex are most dogs that bite people?
questions.explanation:
M.

	Most biters are unneutered males.

questions.text: Which sex of mallard duck rears the young?
questions.explanation:
F.

	Unlike the monogamous geese and swans, most male ducks do not help rear their offspring.

questions.text: What sex are all worker ants and bees?
questions.explanation:
F.

	Males live long enough to reproduce, then die.
